TopicTitle: First orbit achieved, I'm so excited!

Articles.Content:
I know most if not all of you have achieved this, but for me this was a monumental achievement! My space program has launched it's first Kerbonaut into orbit and returned him safely to the ground! Space exploration first steps FTW!! (Only took about 10-15 tries) (I have a hint for anyone new trying to do this, make sure you are turning to 45 degrees during ascent, and not misreading the gimball and only turning 22.5 degrees LOL)

...And here is a nice rear command module shot...never thought I'd get to take a photo like this! I've made it to space!

--Impatience

My space program never took off. Pardon the pun.

Never been to Mun, Minmus or anywhere in between. Except orbiting Kerbol and Dres. Maybe I should get out more...

Congratulations on your first orbit! May this lead to many great adventures!!
FYI, I now realize this is probably posted in the wrong part of the forum, oooops. I = n00b
Congrats on first orbit! You know what they say: if you can make it to orbit you're half way to anywhere!
You, sir, are officially in the club! Welcome! Here we like to go fast, high, and only slow down for atmospheres and Maneuver Nodes!

Congratulations on popping your orbital cherry Now for your next goal you should aim for making a mun impactor... yes I know its billed as a lander but trust me your first time its probably going to be an impactor
Congrats, I'm now playing KSP for almost a year... Today we did orbital mechanics in Physics in school. Was fun, but still hard.

Congratulations on your first orbit!

Only people without MJ will feel this moment of joy. Get ready for Mun landing...I share the joys of yours.

MJ-ker...sorry, you won't and never ever will have the feeling how OP feel. Cause there is only 1 chance, and you let MJ do it for you...

That first stable orbit feels really great. Eccentric, inclined, whatever, you're in freaking space. Congrats. Now it's all about getting that humble path with various vehicles and refining it into something a bit more useful.
Good job! My first orbit was a lot worse than this, it was really, really high, and really, really eccentric
My first orbit had a periapsis of -5,239 and an apoapsis of 12.

Congratulations, Impatience. Orbit is the game's first major milestone, and one of the bigger feel-good moments.

(Also, thread moved to mission reports.)

Edited February 20, 2014 by Vanamonde
'grats. -but can you get back down again?
Congratulations on your first orbit Keep playing, you'll be sending your kerbals off into even greater depths of space before long!

Congratulations on your first orbit!

Only people without MJ will feel this moment of joy. Get ready for Mun landing...I share the joys of yours.

MJ-ker...sorry, you won't and never ever will have the feeling how OP feel. Cause there is only 1 chance, and you let MJ do it for you...

Was this comment really needed? I mean we get it, you don't like people who use MJ. That said, and I use MJ, but I fly my launches by hand. I mean seriously, just because people use MJ doesnt mean they use it as an auto-pilot. Sure, I dont get anything out of getting to orbit unless its a new ship but then again, getting to orbit expected for someone who has played for some 460+ hours.
And usually embrace lithobraking
Congrats, man! I remember my first orbit

Congratulations on your first orbit!

Only people without MJ will feel this moment of joy. Get ready for Mun landing...I share the joys of yours.

MJ-ker...sorry, you won't and never ever will have the feeling how OP feel. Cause there is only 1 chance, and you let MJ do it for you...

True words.

I use MechJeb...

To automate the tedium bits.

But first, I do it by hand. And pen&paper. Looots of paper. (You ever try to analyse a 12-stage Jet/SRB/rocket/nuke vehicle's delta-v, especially if you plan on manually pumping fuel around every now and then. Fun! (not))

And once Mechjeb has shown me shot IT does the job, i very often fire it and revert to manual! I can launch a rickety rocket with less explosions, and more fuel remaining, that MJ's autoascend ever will.

Don't let MJ spoil your adventure by removing the thrill, and don't let the absence of MJ turn your interplanetary adventure into a tedium of routine tasks.

p.s.

Congrats on that first orbit!

You know that awesome feeling you are feeling? You will get it again the first time you land on the Mun.

Or dock in orbit using *only* manual means.

Or aerobrake into Eve

Or discover the XXXXX (spoiler redacted) on Duna, with its map to XXXXXX.

Or circumnavigate Eeloo in a rover.

Or.

Or..

or...

The world of KSP awaits you, you have barely scratched the surface yet!

Guys...please don't spoil OP's joy with our petty arguments about MechJeb.

Congratulations First real orbit is always great thing - and there is much more to come First Mun landing, first Duna landing, first successful Jool aerobraking... Much fun is to be had in KSP, no matter how you decide to play it.

Congrats on your first orbit, it's a special moment.

Did you take your kerbal out for a space walk too?

Congrats on your first orbit, it's a special moment.

Did you take your kerbal out for a space walk too?
Good job! My first orbit was a lot worse than this, it was really, really high, and really, really eccentric
congrats on the first orbit!

Nice job.When I did my 1st orbit it was in the demo and I tried doing a EVA and it did not end well jeb went into deep space lol. I was new at the time.But now I do spacewalks all the time.Wait till you go to the moon that is a fun time doing EVAs.Hey was this in career mode or sandbox?

.Hey was this in career mode or sandbox?

I'm doing this in Career Mode. BTW, did my spacewalk...we had a few problems but we eventually got back into the ship (I might have had to do one or two quick reloads...)
